value.title: Drill Down and Up in Power BI Explained
value.excerpt: Power BI works with hierarchies very easily, and there are buttons to drill down and up. However, sometimes, these buttons are confusing for the users. It is essential to know what each drill down/up option is and how it works, not just for developers but also for the end-users. In this blog and video,

value.title: Extract Parts of a Text Value in Power BI using a Delimiter Power Query Transformation
value.excerpt: If you have a text field and you want to extract a part of that text field, there are multiple ways to do that. You can do this using the SUBSTRING function in DAX. However, These types of actions are better to be done using Power Query transformations. Fortunately, Power Query is very easy and simple

value.title: Power BI Architecture Best Practice
value.excerpt: Using Power BI is simple. However, using it properly needs a good architecture. In a multi-developer environment, the architecture of a Power BI implementation should allow multiple developers to work on the same solution at the same time. On the other hand, the Power BI architecture should be designed

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FCWVX8W1QZk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Split Column by Delimiter in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: If you have a delimiter character (or part of the text) that is repeated multiple times, and you want to extract all the text parts based on that, there is a simple way for it. In this article, I'll explain how to extract multiple parts of a text value based on a delimiter in Power BI using Power Query.

value.title: TOP N Filter in Power BI with Zero DAX Code   Visual Level Filter
value.excerpt: I have previously written articles about how you can write a measure in DAX that helps with TOP N filtering. However, you may not need that calculation for many situations. If all you want is just simply to get the top 10 customers based on the sales amount, or bottom 5 products, etc, then you can simply

value.title: Visualization Tip   Change to Filter instead of highlight   Control the Interaction in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI reports are highly interactive, If you select a column in a column chart other charts will be highlighted. Selecting a slicer value will filter all other visuals in the report. This interactivity can be controlled easily. Despite the fact that this feature has been released in early phases of

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt

value.title: Transcend data analysis together with Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: This module introduces potential ways that people can use Excel and Power BI together. Power BI is a great tool for telling a story through visuals; occasionally, it's beneficial to use Excel for analysis. Excel can make a connection to a Power BI dataset, enabling you to analyze the data by using PivotTables.

value.title: Secure, publish, and share data in Power BI
value.excerpt: This module reviews securing, sharing, and publishing Microsoft Power BI reports as part of Power BI service.

value.title: Provide governance in a Power BI environment
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamental rules, regulations, and policies of a BI governance approach.

value.title: Measure Teams collaboration with the Microsoft Teams insights dashboard in Power BI through Workplace Analytics with Viva Insights
value.excerpt: Learn how to prepare and generate actionable data by using Workplace Analytics with Viva Insights and the Teams insights dashboard in Power BI.  Analyze Microsoft Teams adoption trends from the populated Power BI reports.

value.title: Year over Year and Month over Month Calculations in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly produce time intelligence calcution in Power BI using these easy to follow DAX equations. Elevate your time series analysis.
